definitions: the moving of something from its place or position

examples.text: a displacement of the vertebra at the bottom of the spine

definitions: the removal of someone or something by someone or something else which takes their place

examples.text: males may be able to resist displacement by other males

shortDefinitions: removal and replacement of someone or something

definitions: the enforced departure of people from their homes, typically because of war, persecution, or natural disaster

examples.text: the displacement of farmers by guerrilla activity

shortDefinitions: enforced departure of people from homes

definitions: the amount by which a thing is moved from its normal position

examples.text: a displacement of 6.8 meters along the San Andreas fault

shortDefinitions: amount by which thing is displaced

definitions: the occupation by a submerged body or part of a body of a volume which would otherwise be occupied by a fluid.
shortDefinitions: occupation by submerged body of volume otherwise occupied by fluid

definitions: the amount or weight of fluid that would fill the volume displaced by a floating ship, used as a measure of the ship's size

examples.text: the submarine has a surface displacement of 2,185 tons

definitions: the volume swept by a reciprocating system, as in a pump or engine
the unconscious transfer of an intense emotion from its original object to another one

examples.text: this phobia was linked with the displacement of fear of his father

definitions: the component of an electric field due to free separated charges, regardless of any polarizing effects.
shortDefinitions: component of electric field due to free separated charges

definitions: the flux density of electric displacement.
